subject: Travel
title: The New Seven Wonders Vote
description: Learn The New Seven Wonders Vote in one minute.

hook.text: In 2007, over 100 million people voted online to choose the New Seven Wonders of the World.

buildup.text: Swiss adventurer Bernard Weber organized the campaign. Twenty-one finalists were shortlisted.

discovery.text: The winners included the Great Wall, Petra, the Colosseum, and Machu Picchu.

twist.text: Egypt refused to participate, calling the vote a publicity stunt. The pyramid needed no vote.

climax.text: UNESCO distanced itself from the campaign, saying it was unscientific and commercial.

punchline.text: The world voted, but the experts disagreed.

quiz.question: How many people voted in the New Seven Wonders campaign?
